about.description:
This package is a Special Quasirandom Structure generator written
in Python3/Cython. Please note that the programm currently only
works with Python 3.
about.summary: A command line tool written in Python/Cython for finding optimized SQS structures

name: sqsgenerator

new_version_errors.0.0.4:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '0.0.4' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://github.com/dnoeger/<{name}}/archive/<{version}}.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "sqsgenerator" %}
{% set version = "0.0.4" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/dnoeger/{{ name }}/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 30b5c1011eff8d9f8d9bd24008b028555c3bd11bf5a5b0828b946cb57cfcd82d

build:
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  skip: true  # [not linux or py<35]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - cython
    - gmp
    - pymatgen
  run:
    - python
    - pip
    - cython
    - gmp
    - pymatgen

test:
  imports:
    - sqsgenerator
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/dnoeger/sqsgenerator
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: A command line tool written in Python/Cython for finding optimized SQS structures

  description: |
    This package is a Special Quasirandom Structure generator written 
    in Python3/Cython. Please note that the programm currently only 
    works with Python 3.
  doc_url: https://github.com/dnoeger/sqsgenerator
  dev_url: https://github.com/dnoeger/sqsgenerator

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
    - dgehringer
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.16
